title: kegg-graph
text: KGML format KEGG uses save pathway structure package interfaces . can use functions parse KGML files directly. can build graph object wish expertiese graph analysis R.

what: The output data.frame frame for nodes
title: kegg-graph

what: The output data.frame frame for edges
title: kegg-graph

what: Build a graph from a pathway ID and map results to nodes
title: kegg-graph
text: map differential expression results nodes KEGG pathway graph can use map_results_to_nodes(). input function graph object built kegg_to_graph() list differential expression results tables single differential expression results table. can also pass input map_results_to_nodes() single data.frame differential expression results. dataframe must contain least two columns: one KEGG feature IDs (without organism prefix) another values map nodes (e.g., log2 fold changes). can pass function names columns differ default ones parameters feature_column value_column. defualt parameters : - feature_column = “KEGG_ids” - value_column = “log2FoldChange” multiple differential expression results tables (example one metabolomics one transcriptomics) map nodes can pass list lists. sublist must contain following elements: de_table: data.frame differential expression results value_column: name column de_table containing values map nodes feature_column: name column de_table containing feature IDs (e.g., ENTREZ IDs) correspond KEGG ids graph (without organism prefix).
code: de_results_list <-list(   trans_limma = list(     de_table = data.frame(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_limma),     value_column = "logFC",     feature_column = "ENTREZID"   ),   trans_deseq = list(     de_table = data.frame(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_dds),     value_column = "log2FoldChange",     feature_column = "ENTREZID"     ) )

previous_headings: Build a graph from a pathway ID and map results to nodes
what: Example of usage with a single DE results table
title: kegg-graph
code: pathway <- rownames(res_enrich_IFNg_vs_naive_dds)[6] graph <- kegg_to_graph(pathway) #> Downloading KGML for hsa00563 ... #> Downloaded & cached: hsa00563 #> Downloading KEGG compounds... #> Downloading KEGG glycans... graph <- map_results_to_nodes(graph, de_results_list) #> Mapping differential expression results to nodes... #> Warning in add_results_nodes(nodes_df, results_combined): Multiple results #> mapped to node hsa:8705. previous_headings: Build a graph from a pathway ID and map results to nodes
what: Example of usage with a single DE results table
title: kegg-graph
text: Let’s first build filtered differential expression results table significant results. call function table input. parameter feature_column value column set match column names differential expression results table.
code: de_results_limma <-  data.frame(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_limma)[res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_limma$adj.P.Val < 0.05, ] graph <- kegg_to_graph(pathway) #> Using cached KEGG KGML for hsa00563 #> Loading KEGG compounds from cache... #> Loading KEGG glycans from cache... graph <- map_results_to_nodes(graph, de_results_limma, feature_column = "ENTREZID", value_column = "logFC") #> Mapping differential expression results to nodes... graph

title: Authors and Citation
text: Edoardo Filippi. Author, maintainer. Federico Marini. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Filippi E, Marini F (2025). KEGGemUP: package map differential expression results KEGG pathways. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/edo98811/KEGGemUP.
code: @Manual{,   title = {KEGGemUP: A package to map you differential expression results on KEGG pathways},   author = {Edoardo Filippi and Federico Marini},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/edo98811/KEGGemUP}, }

what: A package to map you differential expression results on KEGG pathways
title: A package to map you differential expression results on KEGG pathways
text: package map differential expression results KEGG pathways

title: A package to map you differential expression results on KEGG pathways
A package to map you differential expression results on KEGG pathways
text: use Kegg pathway visualization function: use single differential expression results table: Make sure two dfault columns: “KEGG_ids” kegg ids “log2FoldChange” values map.
code: library(KEGGemUP)  pathway <- "hsa04110"  # Example pathway ID graph <- kegg_to_graph(pathway) graph <- map_results_to_nodes(graph, de_results_table) graph library(KEGGemUP)  pathway <- "hsa04110"  # Example pathway ID de_results_list <-list(   trans_limma = list(     de_table = data.frame(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_limma[]),     value_column = "logFC",     feature_column = "ENTREZID"   ),   trans_deseq = list(     de_table = data.frame(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_dds),     value_column = "log2FoldChange",     feature_column = "ENTREZID"     ) )  graph <- kegg_to_graph(pathway) graph <- map_results_to_nodes(graph, de_results_list) graph

what: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries
title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries
text: Parse KEGG KGML files extract nodes data frame.

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries
Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries
text: file Path KGML XML file.

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries
text: data.frame following columns: id Unique identifier entry within KGML pathway (id attribute). kegg_name KEGG-specific name identifier entity (name attribute). may include one KEGG identifiers gene IDs, compound IDs, enzyme EC numbers. Preceded organism ID type Type node (type attribute), indicating biological entity class "gene", "enzyme", "compound", "map", "ortholog", "group". link URL linking KEGG resource entry, available (link attribute). reaction Associated reaction ID(s), (reaction attribute). Typically present enzyme entries. graphics_name Display name entry, taken name attribute <graphics> node. label Text label visualization purposes. fgcolor Foreground color graphical element (fgcolor attribute <graphics>). bgcolor Background color graphical element (bgcolor attribute <graphics>). graphics_type Shape representation type graphical element (type attribute <graphics>), "rectangle", "circle", "line". x X-coordinate node’s position pathway diagram (x attribute <graphics>). y Y-coordinate node’s position pathway diagram (y attribute <graphics>). width Width graphical element (width attribute <graphics>). height Height graphical element (height attribute <graphics>).

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries
text: function parses KEGG KGML (KEGG Markup Language) XML file extracts <entry> elements, representing biological entity KEGG pathway diagram. node may contain nested <graphics> elements defining visual properties (position, size, colors) <component> elements define group membership composite entities. resulting data provides tidy, one-row-per-entry representation suitable integration relational data models network visualization frameworks (e.g., igraphor visNetwork).

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract nodes data frame. — parse_kgml_entries

text: file Path KGML XML file.

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract relations and edges data frames. — parse_kgml_relations
text: data.frame following columns: ID source entry (node) pathway, corresponding entry1 attribute KGML <relation> tag. ID target entry (node) pathway, corresponding entry2 attribute KGML <relation> tag. type general type relationship two entries (e.g., "ECrel", "PPrel", "GErel", "PCrel", "maplink"). types describe biological nature connection, enzyme-enzyme relation protein-protein interaction. subtype specific subtype relation, derived <subtype> child elements <relation> node (e.g., "activation", "inhibition", "expression", "compound"). subtype defined, NA. rel_value categorical value associated subtype, encodes apearence arrow (value attribute <subtype>). present, NA.

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract relations and edges data frames. — parse_kgml_relations
text: function reads KEGG KGML (KEGG Markup Language) file, encodes pathway information XML, extracts <relation> elements describe interactions relationships entities pathway. <relation> may contain one <subtype> elements provide additional details interaction. result tidy data.frame suitable network analysis visualization, row represents one relation–subtype pair.

title: Parse KEGG KGML files to extract relations and edges data frames. — parse_kgml_relations
